meanings.definition: A solution of salt in water
meanings.sent1: The chef used brines to enhance the flavor of the pickles.
meanings.sent2: The sailors collected brines from the ocean for their salt supply.
meanings.sent3: The picnic was saved by the forgotten jar of brines for the bland food.
meanings.sent4: Her tears were like brines, salty and full of emotion.
meanings.sent5: The brines shimmered under the sunlight, creating a beautiful sight.

meanings.definition: To soak in or treat with brine
meanings.sent1: She brines the chicken before grilling it for added juiciness.
meanings.sent2: The butcher brines the meat to ensure tenderness.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat accidentally brines itself in the spilled saltwater.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to brines her heart, leaving it heavy with sadness.
meanings.sent5: The old tradition of brining fish has been passed down for generations.

meanings.definition: To preserve in or treat with brine
meanings.sent1: They brines the cucumbers to enjoy pickles all year round.
meanings.sent2: The ancient method of brining was used to keep food fresh.
meanings.sent3: The magician claimed he could brines objects to make them last forever.
meanings.sent4: The memories of childhood brines her mind, keeping them fresh and vivid.
meanings.sent5: The secret to the perfect dish is to brines the ingredients before cooking.
